Find Partitions in a Seurat Object Similar to Monocle3

find_partitions.Rd

Finds partitions (low-resolution clusters) in a Seurat object using Louvain or Leiden clustering, similar to the find_partition function in Monocle3. This function computes partitions by clustering the cells and then grouping clusters into partitions based on connectivity.

Usage

find_partitions(
  obj,
  method = "louvain",
  k = 20,
  reduction = "umap",
  dims = NULL,
  weight = FALSE,
  num_iter = 1,
  resolution_parameter = NULL,
  random_seed = 2020,
  verbose = TRUE,
  partition_q_value = 0.05
)

Arguments

obj

A Seurat object.

method

A character string specifying the clustering algorithm to use: "louvain" or "leiden". Default is "louvain".

k

Integer specifying the number of nearest neighbors (k) to use when constructing the k-NN graph. Default is 20.

reduction

A character string specifying the dimensionality reduction to use (e.g., "pca", "umap"). Default is "umap".

dims

A vector of integers specifying the dimensions to use from the specified reduction. If NULL, all dimensions are used. Default is NULL.

weight

Logical indicating whether to use edge weights in clustering. Default is FALSE.

num_iter

Integer specifying the number of iterations for the Leiden algorithm. Default is 1.

resolution_parameter

Numeric value specifying the resolution parameter for clustering. Default is NULL, which uses the Seurat default.

random_seed

Integer specifying the random seed for reproducibility. Default is 2020.

verbose

Logical indicating whether to display messages during computation. Default is TRUE.

partition_q_value

Not used in this implementation. Included for compatibility.

Value

A Seurat object with partitions added to the metadata (obj$partitions).

Details

This function performs clustering using the specified method and then computes partitions by constructing a cluster graph and finding connected components. Cells belonging to clusters within the same connected component are assigned to the same partition.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
library(Seurat)
# Assuming 'seurat_obj' is a Seurat object with PCA and UMAP computed
seurat_obj <- find_partitions(seurat_obj, method = "leiden", k = 20, reduction = "umap", dims = 1:10)
# The partitions can be accessed via seurat_obj$partitions
}
